constitution.title: LiSu Foundation – Constitution
constitution.subtitle: For Registration in RJSC / NGOAB / Trust / Non-Profit Company

preface.title: About the Name 'LiSu Foundation'
preface.description: The name 'LiSu Foundation' is derived from the initials of two meaningful names — Li (Liakat) and Su (Suria). The name symbolizes unity, family values, and a commitment to humanitarian service.
preface.note: This explanation is for informational purposes only and does not affect the legal structure or governance of the organization.

section1.title: 1. Name of the Organization
section1.name: LiSu Foundation
section1.description: It is a voluntary, non-political, non-profit, humanitarian development organization.

section2.title: 2. Office Address
section2.headOffice: The Head Office of the organization shall be located at:
section2.address: Village: Kaya Kori (Baligange Bazar), Nakla, Sherpur, Mymensingh, Bangladesh.
section2.branches: Branches may be established anywhere in Bangladesh or abroad as necessary.

section3.title: 3. Nature & Character of the Organization
section3.description1: LiSu Foundation is a non-political, non-profit, humanitarian, and social welfare organization.
section3.description2: The organization is dedicated to improving the lives of the poor, orphans, widows, disaster-affected people, and other underprivileged populations.

section4.title: 4. Objectives
primaryObjectives: To provide comprehensive support to the poor and underprivileged
To support the welfare, education, and moral development of orphans and children in remote areas
To ensure access to safe drinking water by installing tube wells and deep tube wells
To construct houses and provide shelter for homeless and disadvantaged individuals
To implement humanitarian programs including Ramadan food distribution, Qurbani, winter clothing, Iftar, and Sadaqah projects
To conduct healthcare services, medical assistance, and other humanitarian welfare programs
To build cooperation, compassion, and a humanitarian bridge between wealthy and underprivileged communities
To carry out charity, Sadaqah, and welfare activities in accordance with Islamic values and principles
To provide educational scholarships and financial assistance to poor and meritorious students (schools, madrasas, and orphans)
To assist in funeral arrangements, burial, and graveyard-related support for deceased underprivileged Muslims
additionalObjectives: To provide disaster relief during floods, storms, cyclones, or emergencies
To create employment opportunities for the unemployed
To collaborate with donors for special humanitarian projects
To enhance community awareness and human development
To engage Bangladeshi expatriates in social welfare activities

section5.title: 5. Membership
categories: Honorary Members (donors or individuals with special contribution)
qualifications: Must accept and uphold the objectives of the organization
Must submit the membership form and be approved by the Executive Committee

section6.title: 6. Executive Committee
section6.term: The term of the Executive Committee shall be 5 years, and may be reformed or renewed as necessary.

section7.title: 7. Meetings
meetings: The Executive Committee shall meet once every 3 months
Emergency meetings may be called when necessary
Decisions shall be made by majority vote
In the absence of the President, the Executive Director shall preside

section8.title: 8. Financial Management
points: The organization is strictly non-profit; no member shall receive financial gain
Funds may be collected through donations, zakat, sadaqah, charity, and local or international support
All financial transactions must be handled through the organization's bank account
Annual financial statements must be audited
All funds must be used exclusively for humanitarian and welfare activities

section9.title: 9. Violation of Rules
section9.description: Any member violating the constitution, organizational ethics, or Islamic principles may face:

section10.title: 10. Amendment of the Constitution
section10.description: This constitution may be amended by a two-thirds majority vote of the general meeting.

section11.title: 11. Dissolution of the Organization
points: All assets shall be used for humanitarian purposes
No member may claim personal benefit

section12.title: 12. Islamic Ethical Principles
section12.description: LiSu Foundation shall operate based on:
principles: Serving humanity for the sake of Allah
Avoiding any activity contrary to Islamic values

threeHumanFigures.title: 1. Three Human Figures (White Silhouettes)
threeHumanFigures.description1: Represents unity, community, and collective effort — three individuals standing together, symbolizing people joining hands for a greater cause.
threeHumanFigures.description2: The upward-reaching shapes also symbolize hope, growth, and upliftment, showing LiSu Foundation's mission to empower others through compassion and service.

centralFigure.title: 2. Central Figure (Middle One Raised Higher)
centralFigure.description1: The middle figure rising upward reflects leadership and guidance, showing how the Foundation leads with moral and humanitarian values.
centralFigure.description2: It can also signify knowledge and spiritual enlightenment, guiding others toward goodness.

curvedBase.title: 3. Curved Base (Arms or Roots Shape)
curvedBase.description1: Represents support and nurturing — just as roots nourish a tree, LiSu Foundation provides strength and care to the community.
curvedBase.description2: The open, welcoming curve symbolizes mercy (রহমত) and service (সেবা) in an Islamic sense — embracing people with kindness.

circularBorder.title: 4. Circular Border
circularBorder.description1: Symbol of completeness and continuity, expressing that humanity, compassion, and faith are interconnected and everlasting.
circularBorder.description2: The circle also implies equality — no beginning or end — where every person has equal value in the eyes of Allah.

colors.title: 5. Green and Gold Colors
colors.greenDescription: Peace, harmony, Islam, and growth — a sacred color in Islamic tradition representing life and paradise.
colors.goldDescription: Honor, sincerity, and divine light — showing the purity and nobility of serving others.

overallMeaning.title: Overall Meaning
overallMeaning.description: The LiSu Foundation logo reflects a community united in faith and compassion, working together for human welfare under the light of Islamic values — symbolizing growth, service, and unity in humanity.

generalPrinciples.title: 1. General Membership Principles
generalPrinciples.description: All members of LiSu Foundation must uphold:
principles: Honesty, integrity, and good moral character
No involvement in illegal, unethical, or haram activities
Regular observance of five daily prayers (Salah)
Commitment to the humanitarian objectives of the Foundation

categories.title: 2. Membership Categories
categories.description: LiSu Foundation recognizes the following membership types:

step1.title: Step 1: Volunteer (Mandatory Requirement)
step1.description: To qualify for any membership, an individual must first serve as a Volunteer.
eligibility: Must not be involved in any illegal or haram activities
Must regularly perform five daily prayers
Must actively participate in LiSu Foundation's Primary Objectives
period: Must maintain good standing and discipline
Must actively contribute to humanitarian activities

step2.title: Step 2: General Member
step2.description: After successfully completing 2 years as a Volunteer, an individual may apply to become a General Member.
eligibility: Completion of 2 years volunteer service with good standing
Continued adherence to Islamic ethics and organizational rules
contribution: Monthly donation: minimum 200 BDT to Maximum above anything
Purpose: To fulfill the Primary Objectives of LiSu Foundation

step3.title: Step 3: Honorary Member
eligibility: Must meet all moral, Islamic, and ethical requirements
May or may not be a General Member
Must be approved by the Executive Committee
contribution: Donation must be used exclusively for primary humanitarian purposes
status: Receives official acknowledgment from LiSu Foundation

step4.title: Step 4: Lifetime Member
eligibility: Must meet all moral, Islamic, and ethical requirements
Must demonstrate long-term commitment to humanitarian values
Must be approved by the Executive Committee
contribution: Donation must be used exclusively for primary humanitarian purposes
status: Highest level of recognition within LiSu Foundation

termination.title: 5. Membership Termination
termination.description: Any member may be suspended or removed if found to be:
reasons: Involved in illegal or unethical activities
Acting against the objectives or reputation of LiSu Foundation

approval.title: 6. Approval Authority
points: All memberships must be approved by the Executive Committee
The Committee reserves the right to accept, reject, suspend, or revoke membership

declaration.title: 7. Declaration Clause (For Forms & Constitution)
declaration.text: All members of LiSu Foundation commit to upholding Islamic values, humanitarian principles, and the objectives of the organization. Membership is a responsibility, not a privilege, and must be maintained with sincerity, discipline, and accountability before Allah.

registration.title: 15.1 Registration
registration.content: LiSu Foundation shall be registered under the appropriate legal framework in Bangladesh, including but not limited to:
items: NGOAB (NGO Affairs Bureau) registration for foreign funding (if applicable)
RJSC (Registrar of Joint Stock Companies) registration as a non-profit company
Trust registration under the Trust Act, 1882 (if applicable)
Compliance with all applicable laws and regulations of Bangladesh

financialTransparency.title: 15.2 Financial Transparency & Accountability
financialTransparency.content: In accordance with Bangladesh NGO laws and regulations:
items: Maintain proper books of accounts and financial records
Prepare annual financial statements audited by certified auditors
Submit annual reports to NGOAB and relevant authorities as required
Ensure all donations and funds are used exclusively for stated humanitarian objectives
Maintain transparency in financial transactions and reporting
Comply with tax regulations and obtain tax exemption status where applicable

governance.title: 15.3 Governance & Compliance
items: Operate in accordance with the Constitution and all applicable laws
Maintain proper records of all meetings, decisions, and activities
Ensure compliance with NGOAB guidelines and reporting requirements
Cooperate with regulatory authorities during inspections and audits
Maintain ethical standards and avoid any activities prohibited by law

amendments.title: 15.4 Amendments to Constitution
amendments.content: Any amendments to this Constitution must be:
items: Approved by a two-thirds majority of the Executive Committee
Compliant with Bangladesh NGO laws and regulations
Submitted to NGOAB and relevant authorities for approval (if required)
Recorded in the organization's official records

policy.title: Donation Policy
policy.content: LiSu Foundation is a registered non-profit organization operating under the laws and regulations of Bangladesh. All donations received are used exclusively for humanitarian purposes as outlined in our constitution and objectives.
policy.note: Important: Donations are generally non-refundable. Refunds may be considered only in exceptional circumstances as outlined below.

conditions.title: Refund Conditions
conditions.description: Refunds may be considered in the following circumstances:
items: Technical error resulting in duplicate transactions
Unauthorized transaction made without the donor's consent
Processing error where the donation amount was incorrectly charged
Donation made by mistake (must be reported within 7 days of transaction)

process.title: Refund Process
process.description: To request a refund, please follow these steps:
steps: Contact us at info@lisufoundation.org within 7 days of the transaction
Provide transaction details including date, amount, and transaction ID
Explain the reason for the refund request
Our team will review your request within 14 business days
If approved, refunds will be processed to the original payment method within 7-14 business days

processingTime.title: Processing Time
processingTime.content: Refund requests are reviewed within 14 business days. Approved refunds are processed within 7-14 business days to the original payment method. Processing times may vary depending on the payment gateway and banking procedures.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: For refund inquiries or to request a refund, please contact us at info@lisufoundation.org with your transaction details.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Our transparent process for providing humanitarian support

step1.title: Application Submission
step1.description: Individuals or volunteer members submit an application based on the specific humanitarian program they are seeking support for (add programs link).

step2.title: Physical Verification
step2.description: After receiving the application, an Executive Committee member conducts a physical, on-site verification to assess the applicant's situation.

step3.title: Eligibility Assessment
step3.description: The verification is carried out strictly according to the program's criteria and guidelines, ensuring that support is provided only to those who are truly eligible and most in need.

step4.title: Approval Decision
step4.description: Based on the verification outcome, the applicant is informed promptly whether they are approved or not approved for the program.

step5.title: Program Implementation
step5.description: Once approved by the Executive Committee, the actual work begins immediately (ASAP), subject to resource availability and project scheduling.

transparency.title: Transparency & Accountability
transparency.description: LiSu Foundation follows a transparent, fair, and Islamic ethical process to ensure that all assistance reaches the right beneficiaries with dignity and responsibility.
